result.name: london-ambulance-service-nhs-trust-blue-light-call-journey-times-to-hasus-by-pct
result.notes:
Conveyance information relating to patients attended to by the London Ambulance Service NHS who were identified from the ambulance patient record as having a deficit on one or more of the face, arm and speech elements of the FAST test, and therefore suspected of having stroke.

Data includes the following aggregated for London:
- Destination – percentage of patients taken to a hospital with a Hyper Acute Stroke Unit (HASU) or to the nearest Accident and Emergency (A&E) department
- Average response times for patients transported to a hospital with a HASU only.

Data source:  London Ambulance Service  NHS Trust (LAS)  
Further information on HASUs: http://www.london.nhs.uk/news-and-health-issues/press-releases/latest-press-releases/stroke-victims-in-london-have-better-access-to-life-saving-treatment-than-anywhere-else-in-the-world

odi-certificate.title: London Ambulance Service  NHS Trust Blue light call journey times to HASUs by PCT

organization.name: nhs-london
organization.title: NHS London (SHA)
organization.description: As part of the changes to the NHS brought about by the Health and Social Care Act 2012, Primary Care Trusts (PCTs) and Strategic Health Authorities (SHAs) ceased to exist on 31 March 2013. Their responsibilities were taken over by Clinical Commissioning Groups and the NHS Trust Development Authority.
